title: Chelsea transfer target Kalidou Koulibaly doesn’t appear keen on Arsenal move – video
text:
Video: Napoli defender Kalidou Koulibaly reacts to being asked to join Arsenal. [ @FaddieFayaz ] #afc pic.twitter.com/XvLMEmC0bW 
— afcstuff (@afcstuff) March 24, 2017 

Napoli defender and rumoured Chelsea transfer target Kalidou Koulibaly was quizzed by a fan about the prospect of joining Arsenal – and his response said it all.
Jose Mourinho report card: Special One's biggest challenge still on course for success The Senegal international has been strongly linked with the Blues for some time, and hinted today that his future could lie in the Premier League .
However, it seems he’s not so taken in by the idea of moving to the Emirates Stadium, as he walked off quickly after being urged to move to Arsenal.
Koulibaly was targeted by Chelsea last summer (Picture: Getty) Gunners fan @FaddieFayaz got a short video clip of himself with the centre-back, saying: ‘Come to Arsenal, yeah?’
More: Football It's done: £70m Chelsea target reveals he's decided his future 
Wenger has still NOT signed new deal, controversial Arsenal figure urging him to stay 
Watch: Man Utd flop morphs into Messi with stunning solo goal for his country 
It’s not clear what Koulibaly himself responded, but it sounded a bit like ‘come on’, suggesting even he thinks he could do better than that.
Antonio Conte tried to sign Koulibaly last summer, and his side look on course for the Premier League title this term while Arsenal struggle as usual to even make the top four.
